thread.title: Doctor Strange Gets The 'How It Should Have Ended' Treatment
thread.title_full: Doctor Strange Gets The 'How It Should Have Ended' Treatment

author: Joseph Schmidt
title: Doctor Strange Gets The 'How It Should Have Ended' Treatment
text:
Doctor Strange Gets The 'How It Should Have Ended' Treatment Joseph Schmidt Start Photo Gallery Back to Article Image of 
Doctor Strange was an entertaining film with a bunch of clever uses of time-travel and teleportation devices, but like with every big-budget superhero flick fans probably shouldn’t dwell on the plot points for too long. 
Because that’s what How It Should Have Ended is for, picking apart all of the various contradictions and plot holes and putting them together in a humorous and well-animated video for your viewing pleasure. 
They finally turned their Eye of Agamotto toward Scott Derrickson and Benedict Cumberbatch ’s film starring the Sorcerer Supreme, poking fun at Kaecilus’ machinations, Stephen Strange’s irresponsible driving, and Wong’s poor weapon choice all within the span of four minutes. 
If you’ve seen the film, it’s well worth the watch and won’t make you enjoy the special effects spectacle any less. It will simply point out the hilarious leaps in logic that every superhero film tends to make. 
Doctor Strange will appear next in Thor: Ragnarok , and is also due to appear in Avengers: Infinity War , which began principal photography this week. Doctor Strange hits digital HD February 14, and DVD/Blu-ray on February 28. Doctor Strange 2016 ComicBook Composite 82.27 #6 All-Time Comic Movies Average rating
